bibl.title: The Cock, the Face and the Bell: Amuletic Jewellery of the Byzantine Period.
bibl.note: 1. Introduction. - 2. The objects [Museum of Cultures Basel: bronze chain with five amulets; - tapestry woven fragment; - tunic fragment found by Albert Gayet at Antinoupolis]. - 3. The amulet types. - 4. Conclusion.

bibl.title: assisted by Elisabeth Ehler, Dress Accessories of the 1st Millennium AD from Egypt. Proceedings of the 6th Conference of the Research Group 'Textiles from the Nile Valley', Antwerp, 2-3 October 2009.
